meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Buddy Wright Tom Nissley Roger Craig Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6246.

td.p: Buddy Wright, an operations engineer from Fort Worth, Texas
Tom Nissley, a writer from Seattle, Washington
Roger Craig, a computer scientist from Newark, Delaware

tr.td: (Alex: The For Dummies books are celebrating their 20th anniversary this year, so we have a whole category about those books.)
SITCOMS BY MOM
MISSISSIPPI MISTERS
THE DOCTOR WILL "C" YOU NOW
FRENCH FIXINS
(Alex: ...a city in Jordan that flourished 2,000 years ago and still fascinates us today.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '"Parenting for Dummies" uses this toy as an analogy for consistency: "it spins until it wobbles, and then it falls down"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: "Parenting for Dummies" uses this toy as an analogy for consistency: "it spins until it wobbles, and then it falls down"

There are a number of important tombs in the ancient city of Petra, like the one behind me, which is not named for a person, but because of the magnificent color striations, is named for this expensive fabric')

tr.td: (Alex presents the clue from Petra, Jordan.) There are a number of important tombs in the ancient city of Petra, like the one behind me, which is not named for a person, but because of the magnificent color striations, is named for this expensive fabric

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 15):

tr.td: Roger
Tom
Buddy

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Roger
Tom
Buddy
NOVELS
SOUNDS ALL AROUND
ANAGRAMMYS
(Alex: We want you to unscramble the [*] in order to come up with the Grammy category.)
WHO'S AT STAKE?
LANGUAGES
4 STRAIGHT VOWELS
